title: Just migrated emails from Internode to The messaging company, how to get Thunderbird active again?
content: Internode have stopped providing email services, and are using The Messaging Company. I want to re-estiblish my Thunderbird account that I was using previously. Can someone explain (simply please) how to re-activate? Many thanks Sue
creator: lagoon1

title: Email accounts exploding
content:
Hello,

I have been using Thunderbird for about 15 years, primarily with version 52.1, on multiple computers, with multiple accounts. Currently I have one commercial google account, and three zoho.com accounts, and I'm using the latest version of Windows 10 Pro 64.

Today, when I went to check my emails, the zoho accounts has THOUSANDS of old emails, six months old or more, with recent dates and times shown, and multiple copies of each email. The total was about 80 thousand, and still counting. The Google account was fine.

So I closed Thunderbird. Then I went to zoho.com to get a web view of my accounts, assuming that they had been hacked. But to my surprise, everything looked normal there. Just my regular emails.

So I went to another computer, and found the same problem with Thunderbird. So I assumed it was something to do with the old version of Thunderbird, and started doing upgrades. When I got to version 68.1, the craziness stopped. I could check accounts, and it came back with no new emails, so I was relieved.

But I did not like the look of 68, and could not find any add-ons or extensions to make it look better. So I decided to continue upgrading, hoping a newer version would look better, or have more options.

When I got to version 101.2 I was really impressed with the colors, but then it went crazy again, downloading thousands of emails. So I kept upgrading to the latest version, 115, but the problem did not go away.

So now I am stumped. Is it something in my settings? How can I fix this? Please, please help!

Thank you, Dave Morris
creator: zohox3

title: Calendar just crashed after not working
content: So I was having problems changing an event to a different day. I performed an update, restarted, recheck updates, restarted PC Open thunderbird, mail appears Okay, calendar Okay Still cannot change an event (appointment) and it has lost the last appointment I added yesterday I decided to just add the adjusted even as a new event, and all calendars (2023, 2024, Holidays, birthdays) all now blank, and .ics fils are all 4.0 kb Seriously what has happened. Was working 3 days ago perfectly, now it's "stuffed". 1. Calendar is Blank 2. Cannot add anything new 3. creating a new calendar (restored from backup) is BLANK -Any suggestions? PLEASE
creator: charles.davids.1999

title: not saving passwords
content:
wont save any passwords and cant get a gmail account to load tried reloading but all my old mail is still there

title: Thunderbird changes hotmail password?
content:
I've appreciated using Thunderbird for an ad-free Hotmail experience for quite some time. I've changed my Hotmail password every few weeks lately and Thunderbird worked fine when I entered the new password at the prompt when Thunderbird started.

Just now however, I needed to get into my Microsoft account that uses the same password as my Hotmail account. My login to Microsoft failed. Trying to understand why, I looked in Thunderbird at the saved password for Hotmail's server:

oauth://login.microsoftonline.com (https://outlook.office.com/IMAP.AccessAsUser.All 

https://outlook.office.com/POP.AccessAsUser.All  https://outlook.office.com/SMTP.Send offline_access)

The saved password was a 464 character long ASCII string totally irrelevant to the password I'd selected for Hotmail and Microsoft.

I went through the password change process for Hotmail, was then able to get into my Microsoft account and restarted Thunderbird. As usual, Thunderbird asked for the new password. I entered it and was then able to receive new mail from the Hotmail server in Thunderbird. However, again, the saved password in Thunderbird for Hotmail was not the password I'd entered.

Next, I deleted the saved passwords in Thunderbird, restarted it and this time it prompted me to be sure I'd downloaded it from a reliable source. I've never seen that prompt before. It came with my Linux Mint installation, so I thought it would be safe, but again there's an irrelevant password saved for my Hotmail account.

It's like it eventually changes my password for Hotmail and Microsoft since I can get mail through Thunderbird with the odd password it saves, but if I use what should be my password for Hotmail or my Microsoft account via a web page interface, the password doesn't work.

I'll have to stop using Thunderbird if this continues.
creator: change2peace+firefox

title: How do I get TB to render <hr> properly?
content:
When there's an
tag in an HTML message, instead of rendering a horizontal line like it should, TB does something else: it indents the rest of the message, adds a bar on the left, and then hides hides it all as "quoted text". The really annoying thing is that this only seems to happen with "normal"
tags that are just part of the received messages body (there is no quoted text in the received message). It doesn't work for top-posted Outlook-generated messages I receive that do contain many thousands of lines of quoted messages. None of that stuff gets hidden. How do I get TB to render
as a horizontal rule?
creator: Grant.Edwards

title: Messages previously marked as read suddenly unread
content:
So my TB installation has approx 45k messages, 8k directories, the directories go 11-deep and some messages go back 25 years. When I ported into TB from Eudora in 2006 I had a problem that all the mailboxes imported were "open" and so I started closing approx 6k drectories in the left-hand pane and ended up simply going back to Eudora. In 2011 when I ported in again everything seemed to be ok until I realised that all the incoming messages were marked "unread". I used Thunderplunger to clear the "unread" flag / set the "read" flag and that was ok - except that the developer stopped supporting Thunderplunger about 3 years back meaning that to mark messaged "read" that had been filtered some way down the directory tree was a bit tedious. But whatever.

Last night out of nowhere 6,434 messages came up as "unread" - some of these dating back to 2008, some 1999.... wtf...? But most of all these are spread all the way down the directory tree and it is going to take ages to clear them all down. I cant be bothered with doing that.

So questions as follows: 1. is this another v115 bug? and 2. given that Thunderplunger is no more is there some nifty way to mark all messages as "read"? Thanks

I used to use
creator: nick.theboatman

Please check your SMTP settings. AUP#Out-1500. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again."

I've been using Spectrum and Thunderbird for many-many years. This problem is going to cost me big-time if not resolved soon. I love THUNDERBIRD!

Please help!

My email address is - respence2@tx.rr.com (972-342-2047)
